com.scalar.dl.ledger.contract

Class StringBasedContract

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scalar.dl.ledger.contract.StringBasedContract

  • public abstract class StringBasedContract
extends java.lang.Object
    A base contract using the internal String representation as it is for the Ledger data, invoke method arguments, and invoke method return type. You can create your contracts based on it. It is recommended to use JacksonBasedContract in most cases, but you can use this class to achieve faster and more efficient contract execution by avoiding JSON serialization and deserialization.

      • getCertificateKey

        @Deprecated
public CertificateEntry.Key getCertificateKey()
        Deprecated. 
        This method will be deleted in 5.0.0. Note that, although it returns CertificateEntry.Key, but it returns the entity ID and key version of a certificate or HMAC secret key tied to the contract.

      • getClientIdentityKey

        public ClientIdentityKey getClientIdentityKey()

      • setContext

        protected void setContext(@Nullable
                          T context)
        Sets a contract runtime context to pass it to functions. Setting a new context overwrites the previous one.
        Parameters:
        context - a contract runtime context

      • invoke

        @Nullable
public abstract T invoke(Ledger<T> ledger,
                                   T argument,
                                   @Nullable
                                   T properties)
        Invokes the contract to Ledger with the specified argument and the pre-registered contract properties. An implementation of the ContractBase should throw ContractContextException if it faces application-level contextual error (such as lack of balance in payment application).
        Parameters:
        ledger - tamper-evident ledger
        argument - contract argument
        properties - pre-registered contract properties
        Returns:
        json-formatted result

      • invoke

        @Nullable
protected T invoke(java.lang.String contractId,
                             Ledger<T> ledger,
                             T argument)
        Invokes the specified contract to Ledger with the specified argument.
        Parameters:
        contractId - another contract ID to invoke
        ledger - tamper-evident ledger
        argument - contract argument
        Returns:
        contract execution result
